storyInfo: It is the last week of shooting for The Death of Lady Dupont, on a Wrankwood studio plate. The Messenger played by Lucian accidentally 'kills' Sir Dupont, but the blood that flows from the actor is not a prop.

attributes.text: He leaves the bed of withered flowers.
\n\nThey say it is a sign of a bountiful harvest.
\n\nAnd so some walked in the embrace of night,
Shut the lips that sound the horn, he said.
\n\nClose the eyes about to witness eternity, he said.
\n\nHe leaves the bed of withered flowers.
\n\nHe writes his epitaph into the stirring dust,

attributes.content: Does Lady Dupont still shut herself in her room?
attributes.name: Gossipy Manservant

attributes.content: It's been three days, and she's hardly touched her food. What shall we do?
attributes.name: Worried Maid

attributes.content: The way I see it, the madam is fretting over nothing.
attributes.name: Gossipy Manservant

attributes.content: As heir to the Dupont family, Victoria's most noble lineage, she is both elegant and intelligent, and no one could fault her for choosing any of her three suitors.
attributes.name: Gossipy Manservant

attributes.content: But that's exactly why she's so troubled.
attributes.name: Worried Maid

attributes.content: The three Rockefeller brothers may look like they come from the same handsome mold, but they each have wildly different personalities and occupations.
attributes.name: Worried Maid

attributes.content: When a wise scholar, a brave soldier, and a romantic poet all ask for your hand at once, can you even imagine choosing which to spend your life with?
attributes.name: Worried Maid

attributes.content: Besides, whatever choice she makes is bound to bring great pain to the other two.
attributes.name: Worried Maid

attributes.content: Why, the very thought!
attributes.name: Worried Maid

attributes.content: The very thought of the bonuses we'll get when one of those millionaires moves in! Whatever choice she makes, I hope she chooses soon!
attributes.name: Gossipy Manservant

attributes.content: How could you be so—
attributes.name: Worried Maid

attributes.content: Cut!
Director Quay?
attributes.name: Worried Maid

attributes.content: Stiff as damned statues.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: (Mutters) Well, it's just exposition anyway. Might as well cut the scene and add a few symbolic empty shots later...
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: (Mutters) Let's just hope our overzealous producer lady doesn't sweat the small stuff.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: You two take a break while we make some adjustments to the script... Actually, don't bother coming back for shooting.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: More adjustments? This guy just can't make up his mind.
attributes.name: Gossipy Manservant

attributes.content: Shh—
attributes.name: Worried Maid

attributes.content: Alright, people, we're not taking a break just yet. So shut up already... shut up!
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Yes yes, I know we've been shooting for two months, and everyone's tired, and the plate's far from the city center, and there are no casinos or shopping districts here, and everything at the self-service bar is undrinkable pisswater...
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: BUT! For better or worse, this is our last week. Time is precious and so is my film.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: The Death of Lady Dupont is the kind of historical tragedy they don't make in Wrankwood these days, exploring Columbia's changing times through the lens of a noblewoman's marriage...
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: So I don't want it looking like some cheap cash-grab when it finally hits theaters!
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Let's move on to the next run-through.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: The Death of Lady Dupont, balcony, scene three... Melanie and Michael, you're up.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: What's the matter, Miss Rutherford?
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: What do you think, boy?
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: Oh, I'm sorry. I shouldn't have made a veteran like you wait a whole minute for me to get ready.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Do you think I'm making a big deal out of nothing?
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: Of course not. Alongside Marianne Blake, you used to be one of the greatest actresses in Wrankwood.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Seniority, status, etiquette... Hate them as much as you like deep down, but you will respect them on my set.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: I'm sorry if I offended you, ma'am.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: So are we ready?
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: I know it's not easy playing three different characters, but don't mix them up like you did last time. You're playing the SECOND Rockefeller, the soldier.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: You're at Lady Dupont's manor, and have just thrown away your older brother's flowers and torn up your younger brother's love letter. You're rushing into your beloved's bedroom to pour your heart out!
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Silence, please—Action!
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Believe me, my love, my two brothers could never match my feelings for you!
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: I've heard more than enough honeyed words, Mr. Rockefeller.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: Were I not the scion of Dupont, were our union to bring the Rockefellers no wealth or status in high society, would you still—
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: You wound me. I am no schemer, and I mean every word I say.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: You know I'm not as smart or sensitive as my brothers. How can I hope to move you, if not through the sincerity of my feelings?
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: And how will you prove it?
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: I recently returned from the battlefield, where I brushed shoulders with death.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: When that shell burst right next to me, when I felt my body and my senses flying away, when I came close to death's door...
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: All I could picture was your face, your smile!
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Er... you have the next line, ma'am—
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Despicable.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: Uh—What?
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: What kind of soldier would twist his face up like you did when speaking of the battlefield? You put so much honey in your words, you could stick a fly to the ground with it.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: I know you've spent the last two months making moves on anything even vaguely female on this plate, but for God's sake keep your private life off the set, boy.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: Not everyone will fall for a wiggle of your ears and a swoosh of your orange tail like that dumb blonde.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: D-Dumb blonde...?
attributes.name: Marion

attributes.content: M-Marion! What are you doing here?
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Why wouldn't the costume designer be on set for the run-through? I need to see if the costumes are in order.
attributes.name: Marion

attributes.content: Or what? Don't tell me you also believe that gossip the rest of the crew's been spreading?
attributes.name: Marion

attributes.content: Right, of course. There's no problem.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Moving on... Michael, your performance needs to fit the character better, or it won't come across as sincere.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: The second Rockefeller's sincerity is the whole point. Without it, how can we possibly convince the audience that this is what pushes Lady Dupont to finally make her decision?
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: You two can take a break while we move on to the next one.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Abner?
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: I'm here.
attributes.name: Abner

attributes.content: We need an evocative transition into the next scene.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Gotcha. We'll go with the plan we talked about yesterday.
attributes.name: Abner

attributes.content: Also, can you stay away from that metal rack? I'm worried the screws will scratch the camera.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: I can't tell if you're the winner of Wrankwood's Best Cinematography award, or the least professional cameraman in town.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Why not both?
attributes.name: Abner

attributes.content: What happened to you, man?
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: No need to make a fuss of it.
attributes.name: Abner

attributes.content: As Lady Dupont and the second Rockefeller's conversation fades out, the camera pans away from the balcony...
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: It moves down the steps, across a row of portraits and antique vases, to the front hall draped with red curtains.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: The front door opens.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: The sound of wind and rain trespasses into the quiet manor. The camera follows, and a black shadow enters the frame—
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Mrrow~
attributes.name: Mysterious and Elegant Creature

attributes.content: What the hell's that black shadow?!
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Is it a ghost? A prop? A hallucination? Somebody's Friedkin pet?
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Do none of you idiots realize what kind of havoc an animal like this could wreak on a film set?!
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Grab it, Abner! Don't let it mess with the camera rails on the ground!
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: With what hands? Or do you want me to smash the damned camera?
attributes.name: Abner

attributes.content: It went your way, Marion.
attributes.name: Abner

attributes.content: I don't have any free hands either! And are you prepared to take responsibility if the costumes get wrinkled? The producer would have a fit!
attributes.name: Marion

attributes.content: Someone stop it!
attributes.name: Marion

attributes.content: Mrow—
attributes.name: Mysterious and Elegant Creature

attributes.content: The mysterious and elegant creature darts through the set, weaving between the wires and delicate equipment laid out over the ground, its two tails moving this way and that as cries are heard up and down the crowd...
Stop painting that background and catch that thing, Tippi! And you there, the prop intern—
attributes.name: Marion

attributes.content: Her name is Moira. Moi-ra.
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Forget it, Tippi.
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: You're, like, way too nice, Molly. You can't let people walk all over you.
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Who cares? Just catch that thing!
attributes.name: Marion

attributes.content: I-It stopped.
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: Well, aren't you a cutie! You're even more mysterious than the monster in that horror flick I saw last night!
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Mind if I use you as reference for the street scene?
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Meow...
attributes.name: Mysterious and Elegant Creature

attributes.content: The mysterious and elegant creature settles onto the prop box, looking up at the two girls with what seems to be displeasure.
Moira cannot help but bend down and reach out to it, but as she looks into its clear blue eyes she feels her mind go blank...
The next moment, the creature has vanished from the set.
Finally...
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: How could you idiots let it get away from right under your noses?!
attributes.name: Marion

attributes.content: Now, now, Marion.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: I'm the one you're mad at. No need to take it out on the newcomers.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: You...
attributes.name: Marion

attributes.content: If you're going to argue, take it outside. Or better yet, off the plate.
After all, no one expects professionalism out there.
Greta.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Back to work, people.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: I thought you'd be more upset about the shoot being delayed.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: I'm not THAT harsh, Steven. Besides, her appearance on set means we're in for a wonderful surprise when it's time to shoot.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: 'Her'?
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Wait, you mean that creature?
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Who else?
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: She's the companion of a guest of mine... and her showing up means that he's finally made up his mind.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: He'll play the Messenger who appears in the next scene.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: Isn't that right...
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: Lucian?
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: ...As you wish.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: Miss.Christine is free. None may interfere with her intentions or actions.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: I apologize on her behalf.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: Hold up, we're making a last minute cast change, just for some pretty boy no one's heard of?
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: It's only a minor role. No need to feel threatened, my handsome leading man Michael.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: And it's not out of nowhere. Greta gave me a heads-up earlier.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Fine, fine.
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: I'm glad you've made your decision, Lucian. Film is a very different beast from stage, so I understand why you needed to take your time thinking it over.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: But that costume fits you so well. I was right to invite you. I guarantee you'll be the next big thing in Wrankwood.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: I can only hope.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: Well, we've delayed enough. If the actors are ready, let's get on with the run-through.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: I take it you've got your lines down, Lucian?
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: I could recite them backwards.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: Alright then... The Death of Lady Dupont, front hall, scene four, action.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: As the second Rockefeller pours his heart out to Lady Dupont on the balcony, a young Messenger from afar pushes open the front door.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Hello.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: He's welcomed by Lady Dupont's brother, who always seems to have a lot on his mind—
attributes.name: Steven
Steven
attributes.content: Oh, for God's sake—where's Sir Dupont?!

attributes.name: Steven
attributes.content: —Dalton!
Where the Hitchcock has he run off to this time? Drinking again?
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Where's my coordinator? Shelly?
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: We're here, we're here.
Thank goodness... *pant*... I found him... I brought Dalton!
attributes.name: Shelly

attributes.content: (Drunken eyes)
attributes.name: Dalton

attributes.content: (Hiccups)
attributes.name: Dalton

attributes.content: I realized he was missing when I took a head count at the waiting area.
attributes.name: Shelly

attributes.content: I searched every food cart, self-service bar, and outdoor rest area—anywhere that might have booze... I finally found him in some bushes by the road.
attributes.name: Shelly

attributes.content: Knife... I found the *hic* knife!
attributes.name: Dalton

attributes.content: He said he was looking for the knife prop that the Messenger is supposed to 'kill' Sir Dupont with.
attributes.name: Shelly

attributes.content: So which one of you sent a drunk to go hunt down a prop? Where's the prop master, Moira?
attributes.name: Shelly

attributes.content: I-I don't know...
attributes.name: Moira

attributes.content: Fine, whatever, as long as we've got the prop.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Costume crew! Get his clothes in order!
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: You do remember what you're playing in this scene, right?
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Of course... a corpse. Nobody does it better. Haha.
attributes.name: Dalton

attributes.content: Pathetic.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: *hic* What'd ya say?
attributes.name: Dalton

attributes.content: I'm sorry, but I simply can't stand people like you.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: You used to be the darling of Wrankwood when pioneer films were in their heyday. Producers were queuing up to book you.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: And now you're just going to let yourself rot, like mud in a pit?
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: Wh-What do you know?
attributes.name: Dalton

attributes.content: I couldn't care less what you've been through. But at least show a shred of self-respect in front of the younger generation.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: ...That's one of the rules of Wrankwood, too.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: You're playing opposite a man who's standing in front of a camera for the first time.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: Fine, fine.
attributes.name: Dalton

attributes.content: *hic*—Whasyourname?
attributes.name: Dalton

attributes.content: Lucian. You may also call me... Phantom.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: Whatever.
attributes.name: Dalton

attributes.content: Sorry kid, didn't know this was your first shoot. But don't worry, just follow my lead. I can play this role hammered, no problem.
attributes.name: Dalton

attributes.content: I'm gonna *hic* try to kill ya to shut ya up, 'cause of the news you brought...
attributes.name: Dalton

attributes.content: We get to scuffling, then you grab this knife and stab me with it... It's a prop so the blade just slides into the handle. I got a blood bag in my chest pocket, and it'll pop with just a little pressure.
attributes.name: Dalton

attributes.content: Just don't get stuck on thinking 'when am I gonna grab the knife', or you won't get in character. Got it?
attributes.name: Dalton

attributes.content: You've read through that letter three times now, Sir Dupont.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: If there's no issue with it, please assemble everyone in the household so I can read it to them.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Dalton

attributes.content: Dalton's eyes meet the young man's, and he swallows the drunken hiccup that had reached the front of his throat.
He sees not a rookie actor on a film set for the first time, but a Messenger who had come all the way from Victoria, his gaze tired but strong.
The studio falls silent. Director Quay has yet to call 'action', but Dalton can feel his counterpart's focus, and Abner's camera points towards them—
He is looking at a natural.
And so he takes a deep breath—
No, this is an official letter from Victoria's royal house. I can't let you read it aloud.
attributes.name: Dalton

attributes.content: If people were to hear that the Dupont bloodline is all a lie, then my sister's marriage to any of the Rockefellers will be called off!
attributes.name: Dalton

attributes.content: All that wealth, all that money that should have been mine, my very future... All gone in an instant, like popping a balloon.
attributes.name: Dalton

attributes.content: Can't you just leave, boy? Pretend you were never here... I'll give you money. I'll give you all the money you want!
attributes.name: Dalton

attributes.content: You have no authority over me.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: You're just a Messenger! What part of this has anything to do with you?
attributes.name: Dalton

attributes.content: The truth.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: What?
attributes.name: Dalton

attributes.content: True, what happens to this household has nothing to do with me. But I've got something to do with the truth, sir.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: Even if I turned around and left right now, the truth of the Dupont family will still have kicked open your door, forevermore.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: I have no power to take away your misfortune. All I can do is to announce its coming—whether you're willing to face it or not.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: For such is my wretched fate!
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: Dalton looks into the young man's eyes and sees the deep pain and sorrow within.
Suddenly, he feels like he has never been so sober.
He does not need to recall his lines. They come to him naturally.
'Pain? Sorrow?'
'Laughable!'
'Who do you think you are?'
Dalton pulls his knife and swings it at the young man—
Sir Dupont and the young Messenger fight over the deadly weapon. It takes only a moment for it to change hands, their actions as coordinated as if they had rehearsed it a thousand times.
Pain?
attributes.name: Dalton

attributes.content: Sorrow?
attributes.name: Dalton

attributes.content: Laughable! Who do you think you are?
attributes.name: Dalton

attributes.content: I will not let you ruin what should be mine!
attributes.name: Dalton

attributes.content: As I said, sir, my only connection here is to the truth.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: From the noble halls of Victoria, to the ruins of Gaul, to the Basilica of Laterano, to the coastline of Iberia...
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: I've walked all four corners of Terra, delivering the silent message of death, and bearing witness to countless meaningless tragedies. The story of the Duponts is but one of them.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: And while I have never sought it, the truth always reveals itself before my eyes—
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: Such is my wretched fate!
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: Shut up!
attributes.name: Dalton

attributes.content: Sir Dupont desperately lunges at the young man before him. The face of the Messenger has become twisted in the struggle.
He notices the young man pause for an instant, then grip the knife again. The point of the knife approaches his chest—
This man must have felt the weight of fate, he thinks.
A lifeless body falls to the ground. Blood, rose petals, the wind and rain.
Cut!
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Did you get all that, Abner? I think we might be able to use this take as is!
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Sure did!
attributes.name: Abner

attributes.content: (Claps)
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: Is this really this guy's first time on camera, Steven?
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Greta said he used to be part of a theater troupe.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Oh, a stage actor...
attributes.name: Michael

attributes.content: Honestly, I'm more shocked by Dalton. I haven't seen such a convincing performance from him in ages.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Get up, Dalton! We're packing up. But if you want a drink tonight, I'm buying! Haha—
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: ...Dalton?
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Why isn't he getting up? Check on him, Shelly!
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: It is as if the air has frozen.
Dalton lies in front of the steps, not stirring even as Shelly dashes to his side.
The blood bag in his suit pocket has already run dry, but blood continues to seep from his chest.
Filled with a terrifying thought, Shelly reaches out toward the red liquid on the ground with a trembling hand—
It is warm, sticky, and metallic.
Th-This is real blood!
attributes.name: Shelly
